title.narrative: EQUITABLE AND SUSTAINABLE ACCESS TO EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2021, 2.4 million OOSC in 12 KRC3-engaged countries have participated in early learning, primary or secondary education through UNICEF supported programmes (in humanitarian and development contexts), which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2030, girls and boys (including adolescent), are better prepared to start school and have enhanced opportunities to complete a quality and inclusive basic education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, 2.4 million OOSC in 12 KRC3-engaged countries have participated in early learning, primary or secondary education throughUNICEF supported programmes (in humanitarian and development contexts)

description.narrative: WCARO in collaboration with HQ and financialsupport from GPE, ECW, EU, Norway, Germany and Canada, contributed to strengthened capacities of 24 COs and governments through newly generated public goods and evidence on equity and inclusion, high level policy advocacy, improved innovative and gender responsive strategies to support equitable access to education in development and humanitarian contexts. As a result, over the 2018-21 period, more than 8.6;million OOS children participated in education with UNICEF support with an increased focus on multi-sectoral programming for adolescents. In addition, 153,000 adolescents aged 10-19 participated in skills development programs. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/01/2022
